name: tactically
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that relates to a planned method of achieving something: He voted tactically to try to keep the Conservatives out. Tactically, he was regarded as a football genius.
in a way that relates to the organization and use of soldiers and equipment in war: You only have one platoon that can manouevre tactically at a time. See
tactical
More examplesFewer examplesCoonerty wonders now if it might not have been better, tactically, to continue fighting those individual battles.It's a tactically brilliant move.What looked as though it was working tactically in the first half of the game completely failed in the second.Thomas was excellent "operationally and tactically," according to Army Col. Ty Seidule. The wapons were tactically employed in special missions during Operation Desert Storm.
